data.title: Fixed call to Initialize OpenGL states for iOS. Re-Enabled ES2.0 as default context on iOS.
data.body: It will fallback to 1.1 if 2.0 fails.

data.title: Fix for issue #167
data.body: LZX decompression requires Position and Seek, and the underlying Java.IO.InputStream does not support those. Work-around fix is to copy the input stream to a memory stream for Android.

data.title: Improvements to XNB loading and a Mono for Android 4.0 fix
data.body:
Added proper reading of 7-bit encoded ints as used in XNB files.
Added support for shared resources.
Added support for external references.
Removed Seek before each block decompression (Seeks are expensive and this one seemed to be redundant).
Added ContentReader.ReadVector4 and ContentReader.ReadQuaternion.

Removed int typecast in SoundPool constructor (change in Mono for Android 4.0).

data.title: resource problems after OnResume
data.body:
http://monogame.codeplex.com/discussions/281277

When - in the android app lifecycle - you hit an onresume after an onstop because another app came forward I am seeing all the textures that were previously loaded being corrupt but any textures loaded from that point are fine.

data.title: Default to ES 1.1 for now. Developers can define ES20 to test out pre-apha ES 2.0 support.
Changes to allow Portrait and upside-down portrait to render correctly.
data.body:
Sorry for the delay in getting this fix out. But it turned out to be simpler than what I was trying to do a week ago. Basically don't call GL.Ortho twice in succession :S. I feel so thick for not spotting it ealier. But it did allow me to fix an issue in Unsidedown portrait to do with Scissor Rectangles. With this fix, I think 2.1 is ready. 

We need to talk first thing in the morning, if anyone is around.

data.title: Fixed several input keys on Windows
data.body: Fixed keys D0, OemQuestion, RightShift, RightWindows in WindowsGameWindow.cs

data.title: Updated SoundPool API for M4A 4.0
data.body: Updated SoundPool API for M4A 4.0

data.title: Several fixes and addition
data.body:
There were duplicate rate defined by coincidance
Missing Characters properties for SpriteFont
Project includes now the correct files.
Unintentional modification in the project file.

data.title: Remove hack for pausing and stopping sounds
data.body:
The previous hack made it impossible to pause or stop sounds shorter
than 2 seconds. This caused problems with short sound effects,
especially looped sounds.

data.title: Remove hack for pausing and stopping sounds
data.body:
The previous hack made it impossible to pause or stop sounds shorter
than 2 seconds. This caused problems with short sound effects,
especially looped sounds.

data.title: Changes to add Resume method to Sound.cs as well as missing Xact*.cs files
Various changes related to SoundEffectInstance across Android and iOS.
Glyph misplaced in rare case
data.body:
When one uses a SpriteFont XNB file made from an image, it would improperly place the glyph if there are any space on the left hand side of a glyph.
Files demonstrating the situation can be found here: https://docs.google.com/open?id=0B5VJNChSb_NFOWY1NjUyZGQtMTQ5OC00MmRjLWFhYzEtMGUzMzM3NDA0NTRm
FontTester-4a.png – How XNA displays it
Sugar-MonoGame-cropped.png – How MonoGame used to display it.
Game1.cs – The sample program code.
fallback-font.xnb – The font that was used.

data.title: Develop
data.body:
Added Resume method to Sound class to call NSSound.Resume(), and added
functionality to other classes to use Resume when appropriate

data.title: Gesture Support for Android
data.body:
This implements basic Tap, and DoubleTap gesture support. 
Updated the android project to include the Act sound classes

data.title: Fix ContentManager to only load objects of IDisposable so that there are non added as null
data.body: In the unload method there were problems with null objects

data.title: Modifcation to the window level when switching to full screen.
data.body: Reported by mokuba here: http://monogame.codeplex.com/workitem/6646

data.title: Need to check for null event handlers before calling them.
Linux & Xbox 360 Controller
data.body:
Updated for the Microsoft Xbox 360 controller input under Linux (openSUSE). Since the Linux driver for the Xbox 360 controller is a port of the Mac driver, it is possible that this modification works as well on Mac (further investigation needed on this).
Added suggested code for the "BigButton" in comment which is possibly the Guide button. (Key: "Suggestion: Xbox Guide button <=> BigButton")
Added checking gamepad's name to identify Microsoft Xbox controller.

data.title: Some SoundBank fixes
Preliminary proper SoundBank support
data.body:
So like, you tell a Cue to play. That looks up the variations and chooses sound to play. That sound tells a bunch of clips to play simultaneously. Each clip plays a series of events, which plays the actual audio.

Probably a better way to get it working than passing down the commands all the way :/

data.title: Linux & Xbox 360 Controller
data.body:
Updated for the Microsoft Xbox 360 controller input under Linux (openSUSE). Since the Linux driver for the Xbox 360 controller is a port of the Mac driver, it is possible that this modification works as well on Mac (further investigation needed on this).
Added suggested code for the "BigButton" in comment which is possibly the Guide button. (Key: "Suggestion: Xbox Guide button <=> BigButton")
Added checking gamepad's name to identify Microsoft Xbox controller.

data.title: Linux: new Sound.Rate property -- required by code
data.body: SoundEffectInstance.Pitch property were trying to access Sound.Rate member, but were not available in the Linux version. My fix however does not implement it in code, only adds a functioning property, that may needs to be further implement.

data.title: Add back call to Sampler State settings after espes's modification to ClampToEdge
data.body: Add support for IsActive as well as implementations for events Activated, Deactiviate, Exiting and Disposing.

data.title: SamplerState texture clamping fix
data.body: GL_CLAMP_TO_EDGE rather than GL_CLAMP replicates DirectX's (and thus XNA's) texture clamping behavior, see http://www.opengl.org/resources/code/samples/sig99/advanced99/notes/node64.html

data.title: Support M4A's in WaveBanks
data.body: Makes it easy to one day distribute a WaveBank converter

data.title: Develop
data.body: Fix for Windows texture loading

data.title: Fixes to WaveBank, Audio Engine, updated MonoGameProgram, update Sound.cs on Linux
data.body:
Fix to allow WaveBank and Audio Engine to start working (update loop needs looking at)
Added OnResignActivation and changed OnActivated to set the IsActive flag in MonoGameProgram.
Added Rate property to the Sound.cs under Linux.
